alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Pine County through 400 PM CDT... At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brunswick, or 12 miles west of Pine City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Henriette around 340 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Brook Park and Hinckley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
